key.name: What brings you here?
Sailing is always a breeze. Hee. See what I did there?
You want to go to $map:02000001$? Why are you asking me? You should go to the Chief.
I thought sea dogs were adventurous, and yet you won't even let a friendly stranger onto your boat?

You sail to $map:02000001$ by first going to $map:02000062$, and right now the water's too choppy for this boat. Besides, when conditions are like that, only the Chief can authorize the departure of a large ship.
What seems to be the problem?
Oh dear, you're barely clinging to life! Would you like to pay $paneltyPrice$ mesos to get treated now?
You're looking pretty healthy to me, $MyPCName$, but if you're ever sick or wounded, I can help.
Everyone gets sick now and then, you know.
When that happens, I can heal you.
My services are available for a modest fee.
What brings you here?

Everyone wants to join the Royal Guard, but very few are actually qualified. It is imperative that Royal Guard members be strong in body and spirit, for we are the Empress's last line of defense. Hmm, I must admit, you do seem fairly strong.
We're always looking for great swordsmen with the strength to protect the Empress and her palace. How'd you like to join the Royal Guard?

In times like this, only we can protect Her Majesty and Minister $npcName:11000074[gender:0]$. It's the most important job in the world. After you've grown a bit stronger, you should consider joining the Royal Guard.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?

We royal guards protect the palace under the command of Minister $npcName:11000074[gender:0]$. Even though the much-awaited court was canceled because of the earthquake, there is no price too high when it comes to keeping the empress safe. We must honor our oath to protect her from anything, or anyone, that would do her harm.
Don't tell me you've never heard of Minister $npcName:11000074[gender:0]$?
Hmm. I knew people had traveled far and wide to attend the royal court, but you must have come from very far away to be so ignorant of the recent happenings in $map:02000001$.
I'm quite busy at the moment, but I'm sure there are plenty of people in $map:02000001$ who would be happy to educate you.
Remember, no longer are you some aimless adventure wandering the land, but rather a proud Knight and defender of the realm! Now, are there any questions you'd like answered?
What should I do now?

As it stands, you're too weak to fend for yourself, let alone protect the Empress. $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ is a merchant of fine equipment, and probably has some excellent Knight gear for sale. Go get suited up, and commence your training beyond the walls of $map:02000001$!

As you train, you'll ascend to new levels, and become ready to learn new skills. To see the skills you can learn, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.

Want to <font color="#ffd200">upgrade a skill</font>? Press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires Crystals.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently.
As for $itemPlural:40100022$, I don't think you're quite ready.
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become a... Berserker? Well, I hope you don't regret your decision.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become a... Wizard? Well, I hope you don't regret your decision.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become a... Priest? I suppose they have their own role to play on the battlefield. Well, I hope you don't regret your decision.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become an... Archer? Well, I hope you don't regret your decision.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become a... Heavy Gunner? Well, I hope you don't regret your decision.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become a... Thief? What a dishonorable profession. Perhaps you weren't cut out for the job in the first place.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?

You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become an... Assassin? You'd better not be conducting any business in our fair city unless you want to spend the rest of your life rotting in the dungeon.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?

If I'm not mistaken, you're a Runeblade—a warrior versed both in swordplay and runic magic. I'm skeptical on whether you can really master both, but it's noble of you to try. In any case, you're quite far from home. Did you have any questions I can answer?
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?

Ah, yes, I've heard of you. Your methods are a bit unrefined, but you have a sense of determination paralleled by only the greatest Knights. It's too bad, we could use someone like you in the Royal Guard.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?

I'm sorry, but I don't believe you possess the necessary qualifications to join the Royal Guard. The job requires great stores of both fortitude and determination, and it's my assessment that you possess neither.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
Do you want to become a true warrior?

Argh, this place is so boring, it's driving me crazy! If it weren't for the War Chief's order, I would be cracking skulls on Vayar Mountain and having a blast! Hey, you look pretty tough. How are you in a fight?

With a greatsword in our hands, we're fearless in battle. We can be overzealous sometimes, but that's inevitable when you've got our passion for fighting. So, how'd you like to swear fealty to the War Chief and walk the path of the Berserker?

Argh, this place is so boring, it's driving me crazy! If it weren't for the War Chief's order, I would be cracking skulls on Vayar Mountain and having a blast! Hey, you look pretty tough. How are you in a fight?
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
We wouldn't be able to survive the sunbaked steppes of $map:02000051$ if it weren't for our War Chief. He's a great warrior and greater leader. Our trust in him is unwavering.
If you want to meet him, then go to $map:02000051$'s western plateau. But first, you'll have to get approval from his son and our vice chief, $npc:11000009[gender:0]$.
Oh, and when you see him, just be yourself and be honest. He can tell instantly when you're hiding something.
You must not get around much if you haven't heard of Vayar Mountain. It's south of $map:02000051$. We named it after the giant golems that lurk inside.

The golems, or Vayars, were created by the ancients to protect their sanctum. That was centuries ago, and the ancients are long gone. But the Vayars remain, protecting the mountain from any adventurers brave or foolish enough to enter.
Speaking of which, I've heard rumors that someone evaded the Vayars' detection and snuck into the mountain. What was their name? I can't remember...

Sometimes in the heat of battle, I achieve inhuman feats simply because, in my rage, I forget fear and all my weaknesses. I wouldn't count that as a blessing, though... Some things are worth forgetting, but you must never forget who you are. Now, was there something you wanted to ask me?
What should I do now?
First, arm yourself to the teeth. $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ is a merchant of fine equipment, and probably has some great Berserker equipment for sale. Gear up and head out to battle!

Crush all the foes who stand before you, and you will soon grow to new levels. Then you will find yourself ready to learn new skills. To see the <font color="#ffd200">skills you can learn</font>, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.

Want to <font color="#ffd200">upgrade a skill</font>? Press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires <font color="#ffd200">Crystals</font>.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently.
There's also $itemPlural:40100022$, but I don't think you're ready for those just yet.
You've really chosen to become a Knight? I don't know what you'll accomplish waving a dinky sword like that around, but good luck surviving.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.

You've really chosen to become a Knight? I don't really see how shouting gibberish from musty old tomes is going to keep you alive in battle, but I won't tell you how to live what's left of your life.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
A priest? You've chosen to be a Priest? A fat lot of good prayer is going to do you against a horde of charging Koborcs.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.

You've really chosen to become an Archer? Striking down hapless foes from a distance is great, until your quiver runs dry. When the enemy comes bearing down on you, you'll wish you'd gone with a blade.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
You've chosen to become a Heavy Gunner, of all things? Guns are a crutch of the cowardly. A true warrior faces their opponent head on. Don't look to me when that cannon jams in the heat of battle.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
You've chosen to become a Thief? Throwing your only weapons at the enemy seems like a foolhardy strategy, but who am I to stand in the way of a someone with a deathwish?
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
You've chosen to become an Assassin? Skulking around in the shadows, hoping to strike without being seen... There's no honor in that.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
You've chosen to become a Runeblade? To split one's focus between two completely different arts in the midst of battle seems like a reckless strategy. Perhaps you'll prove me wrong by not dying.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.

I sense your fighting spirit is akin to the rage that fuels us Berserkers. A fire that burns within the soul and cannot be quenched! Some advice from one warrior to another: never let your anger get the better of you on the battlefield, or you might wind up dead.
Tell me about the War Chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.

The rage that fuels us Berserkers is a hot and roiling one that scorches the soul. And I can see it's just not in you. You're just like everyone else... you'll never know what it feels like to be truly alive.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
Ugh... I hate being bothered. What is it?
Honestly, I don't care about politics or the court. My time is much better spent reading books in $map:02000031$.

People don't understand the value to be found in dusty tomes and conversing with the fairies in $map:02000023$. But you have a certain inquisitiveness in your eyes, an intellectual spark. You might make a good Wizard. I'm not going to push, but if you're the arcane arts, I'd be willing to assist you.

Honestly, I don't care about politics or the court, and you shouldn't waste your time on things like that either. Come see me if you ever want to discuss what actually matters in this world. I've got plenty of wisdom to share.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?

It seems the simple minds of ordinary folk can't understand us Wizards. We're more interested in scholarly matters, like understanding the origin of this world and what caused the earthquake, than we are in whether the empress holds her court.
Some people think the earthquake was not a naturally occurring phenomenon, and I'm inclined to agree with them. There's evidence to support such a theory...
And you have to admit, it's suspicious that the palace canceled court, which would have been the first one in quite a long time, just because of a simple earthquake. Very suspicious indeed...

What could I possibly have to discuss with you? You and I have nothing in common. Are you looking for magical body-building tips or something? We of the arcane arts don't waste our time trying to enhance our physical forms, as we know that the font of our power lies within.
I'm simply pursuing my fullest potential, just like you're doing.

Ultimate potential? Suuuure, I can help. Unleash your "ultimate potential" with my patented brew of enchanted smoothies! They can be yours for the low, low price of 1,200 mesos! Pffft. You sound like you've been roped into some kind of scam.
Let's talk about something else.
Are you still here? I'd suggest you stop wasting my time, before I make you a guinea pig for my magical studies.
Do you know who I am?
What, are you some kind of celebrity to the common-folk? Why would I know anything about— Woah... what's up with your aura?

I didn't notice it while I was busy trying to ignore you, but your aura is like nothing I've ever seen. I sense two opposing forces swirling within you. It's like watching two stupid salamanders trying to swallow each others' tails.

The first energy unlike anything ever described within the Encyclopedia Arcana... It almost resembles the energy of nature, but... it's so condensed. Incredible. I would never have believed a mortal could accumulate so much power in a single lifetime.
And the second is something darker. It's almost feels like... No, that's not possible.
I don't know what you're talking about.
Just what in the world are you?
I have no memory of my past.
Huh? Really? Were you in some kind of accident...? Come closer. I know just the spell for reading memories.
(Move closer.)
Stay perfectly still. <font color="#909090">(She places her hand on your head and begins to recite an incantation. A spark leaps from her finger tips, and your head starts to feel fuzzy.)</font>
I can't see anything... There's a thick purple haze swirling around inside your head, it's obstructing my view.
I don't believe it. Could you really be...!? No, it's better not to rush to any conclusions. I've got to consult with my colleagues. In the mean time, I'll be keeping an eye on you. Please leave now.
Change the subject.

A Wizard's life is lonely and difficult. We can never stop studying until we reach the very zenith of magical knowledge. You've got quite a road ahead of you. Is there anything you want to ask a fellow scholar?
What should I do now?

Before begin your journey, you should see that you're properly equipped. $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ is a purveyor of fine equipment, and probably has some adequate Wizard gear for sale. Buy whatever supplies are necessary, and venture out into that great, wide world to expand your knowledge!

As your studies progress, you will attain new levels. This will allow you to learn new skills. To see the <font color="#ffd200">skills you can learn</font>, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.

When you're ready to <font color="#ffd200">upgrade a skill</font>, just press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires <font color="#ffd200">Crystals</font>.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently. It would be best to hunt such foes with a party.
And as for $itemPlural:40100022$—well, you can learn about those on your own.
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Knight.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Berserker.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Priest.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Archer.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Heavy Gunner.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Thief.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Assassin.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Runeblade.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court... nor do we care who you are. Our interests lie in more scholarly pursuits.
What do you care about, then?
Do you know what caused the earthquake?
There's another subject I'd like to ask you about.
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court... nor do we care who you are. Our interests lie in more scholarly pursuits.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
There's another subject I'd like to ask you about.
How may I help you?

The recent earthquake has struck fear into the hearts of many. We restore the people's hope by spreading the goddess's teachings. Would you join us on our holy mission? You seem more than qualified to serve the goddess.
Illuminate this world with your good heart and unshakable faith. The goddess awaits with open arms all who you will shepherd into the light.
The recent earthquake has struck fear into the hearts of many. We restore the people's hope by spreading the goddess's teachings. Would you join us on our holy mission?
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
The road between $map:02000062$ and $map:02000001$ bore the brunt of the earthquake's damage. Fortunately, the road was nearly deserted when the shaking began.
I know that many are disappointed about the court's cancellation, but I think the can all agree that our current focus should be on supporting one another, and dealing with the damage of the quake.
Oh, what a silly question! She's the empress, of course. $npc:11000075[gender:1]$ was surely just as disappointed about the court as everyone else, but her safety is paramount to Maple World.

If you're here for an audience with the Empress, you might as well go home. She's too busy these days governing the realm. Since the incident, the people have relied on her strong leadership more than ever.
$MyPCName$, do you believe in... the Light?
I only believe in what I can see.
The Light shines on everyone, regardless of their belief or lack of belief.
What's the Light ever done for the poor of $map:02000100$?

I believe the ordeals we experience throughout life are ultimately blessings in disguise, arranged by the Light. Hardship happens for a reason. I shall pray for you and everyone else. May the Light's blessing be with you wherever you go.
Let's talk about something else.
$MyPCName$, do you believe in... the Light?
What do you mean by "the light"?

The Light <font color="#ffd200">shines on everyone</font>, regardless of their belief or lack of belief. It <font color="#ffd200">guides</font> you through the darkness, keeping you from wandering astray.
No light has ever guided me.
You just haven't noticed it. I can see it all around you, though it is rather dim.

You may not realize it, but that warm light is guiding you along your path. (You think that's a rich presumption. Doesn't this person know that this light has nothing to do with you? Your guide is the Lone Spirit and the Master's teachings.)
Change the subject.
Don't forget, you're now an agent of the Empress and, by extension, an agent of the goddess. It is your duty to perform good deeds and help the weak. Now, do you have any questions?
What should I do now?

To help the weak and needy, you yourself must be strong. $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ is a merchant of fine equipment, and probably has some excellent Priest gear for sale. Once you're properly equipped, you should venture forth and enact the will of the goddess.

In your service to the goddess, you'll inevitably reach new levels. When this happens you'll be able to learn new skills. To see the <font color="#ffd200">skills you can learn</font>, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.
Press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires <font color="#ffd200">Crystals</font>.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently.
$itemPlural:40100022$, you are dangerous, and must be handled with care.
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Knight. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Berserker. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Wizard. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Archer. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Heavy Gunner. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Thief. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Assassin. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Runeblade. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen your path. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
Did the earthquake cause a lot of damage?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
Let's change the subject.
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen your path. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
Talk to $npcName:11000043[gender:1]$ about a different subject.
Whatever this is, please get to the point.

The Green Hoods are a militia group with a long, storied history. Right now, we're keeping an eye on the opportunists who might try to take advantage of the chaos of recent events. We want to prevent as much crime as possible, but that requires talent and mettle. And you... you look like you've got both of those.
Our sharp arrows never miss their targets. How would you like to join us on our mission to restore order to this world?
The Green Hoods are a militia group with a long, storied history. How'd you like to join us and punish those who would do the world harm?
Tell me about the Green Hoods.
Tell me about the criminals.

The Green Hoods are a militia group founded by the legendary archer, Haster. The current commander is a firebrand named Oska. She's the fifth leader in the group's history, and some might say its greatest. If you want to meet her, you'll need to go to $map:02000076$.
Haven't you noticed? Petty crimes like theft and pickpocketing have skyrocketed since the earthquake. The guards are so busy trying to restore order that they can't keep eyes on everyone.

This couldn't be avoided. There's been such an enormous influx of people into the city from all over Maple World, there was bound to be more than a few bad apples. I just hope order will be restored soon.
$MyPCName$, you remind me of an arrow that's just been loosed from its bow.
How so?
Because... you seem like somebody that never looks back, someone who simply moves forward in spite of uncertainty.
Let's talk about something else.

People <font color="#ffd200">suffer</font> when their daily activities are threatened by crime. We Green Hoods exist to ensure <font color="#ffd200">peace and safety</font>, even though that's a challenge without end.
What about you? Have you ever felt threatened by anything? <font color="#909090">(Memories of Brother $npcName:11001715[gender:0]$ and $npcName:11001706[gender:1]$ flash through your mind.)</font>
I prefer not to think about such things.

Fighting crime is only a means to an end. Our <font color="#ffd200">true mission</font> is to protect this whole world from all threats, so that everyone can live without fear. We won't stop until we achieve that.
Change the subject.
Remember, you're not some aimless adventurer anymore. You're in the Green Hoods now, and that means you've got a mission and a creed. So, anything you'd like to ask?
What should I do now?

You're of no use to the Green Hoods without suitable gear. $npcName:11000004[gender:0]$ is a vendor of fine equipment, and probably has some great Archer gear for sale. After you're properly equipped, you should head beyond the city walls and dole out law to the lawless.

As you train, you'll ascend to new levels, and become ready to learn new skills. To see the skills you can learn, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.

Want to <font color="#ffd200">upgrade a skill</font>? Press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires Crystals.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently. So you know, keep that in mind.
As for $itemPlural:40100022$... Well, you won't just find them lying around.
It's too bad you've decided not to join the Green Hoods. Still, we'd greatly appreciate any assistance you're willing to offer punishing those who bear ill will for the people of these lands.
Tell me about the Green Hoods.
Tell me about the criminals.
It's too bad you've decided not to join the Green Hoods. Still, we'd greatly appreciate any assistance you're willing to offer punishing those who bear ill will for the people of these lands.
Tell me about the Green Hoods.

Talk to $npcName:11000045[gender:0]$ about a different subject.
Do you have something to say to me?

Everyone's so on edge right now, but not me... In fact, I can't wait to show the rest of the world what I can do! How about we forget about everything and go blow some stuff up? I'll even help you pick out your own cannon.
I'm not afraid of anything as long as I've got my giant cannon with me. Unlike people, it'll never disappoint me. What do you say, want to become a Heavy Gunner?
Everyone's so on edge right now, but not me... in fact, I can't wait to show the rest of the world what I can do!
What's that weapon on your back?
What's there to do around here?
This is a cannon, and it's the greatest! It can tear things up from a zillion feet away. Here, wanna see?
Hahaha! Did you think I was serious? If I spun up my cannon right now, I'd send this whole place crumbling down.
Fun is in the eye of the beholder. If you want to live a happy life, then figure out what you really want to do, and do it for the rest of your life.
Just keep trying new things until you get to something that sticks! Anything goes, as long as you don't hurt anybody. Well, it's okay if they deserve it.
I became a mercenary because a boring traditional life wasn't for me. And now I get to lug this beauty everywhere I go and blow stuff up!

I came here as some doctor's bodyguard. But I got tired of escorting him to all his stuffy events. I'm actually pretty excited about all the recent chaos. I know some people are grumpy about it, but it's an opportunity for me to take on adversaries tougher than I ever dreamed. I'm stoked!
Look at my weapons, $MyPCName$. Heavy Gunners use firearms like these. Amazing, huh?
True warriors rely on more than their weapons.
You don't know what you're talking about. My cannon could blow you to pieces in a single second!
And I could break your cannon in a tenth of a second!
That's ridiculous! You know what, you're just no fun. Get lost.
Let's talk about something else.
Look at my weapons, $MyPCName$. Heavy Gunners use firearms like these. Amazing, huh?
Take a look at $npcName:11000046[gender:1]$'s cannon.
Let me tell you about this cannon. It's specially forged in Taliskar... <font color="#909090">(You touch the cannon, and instantly feel cold and dizzy. Her voice sounds like it's miles away.)</font>

Heh, I told them there was only person who could handle this cannon, and that person was standing right in front of them! Heh, heh. It was me, get it? Hey, I asked you a question! Are you even listening?
Hey, what's going on? You look pale. And you're sweating like crazy. Ha, ha, is touching my cannon that exciting?
Hey. What's happening to you? <font color="#909090">(Her cannon brings up images from the nightmare you used to have when you slept in Halo Mountain. You'd better leave.)</font>
I want to leave.

Oh. Well, fine. I was going to show you the awesome things my cannon does, but I guess not. What's wrong with you, anyway? Been traumatized by cannons or something? Wouldn't surprise me, since they're so powerful. They should only be handled by the fearless, anyway.
Change the subject.
It'll be much more fun to travel around the world, looking for worthy opponents, than protecting grouchy old dudes.
What should I do now?

If you want to take on tough serious, you need serious hardware. $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ can hook you up with some sweet Heavy Gunner equipment. Go gear up and introduce yourself to the world outside with a bang!

Keep shooting stuff, and eventually you'll reach a new level. Then it'll be time to learn new skills. To see the <font color="#ffd200">skills you can learn</font>, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.

When you're ready to <font color="#ffd200">upgrade a skill</font>, just press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires <font color="#ffd200">Crystals</font>.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently.
And as for $itemPlural:40100022$... Hah, that's way out of your league.

Hm, you're not a Heavy Gunner, $MyPCName$. You know what that means? You don't know how to have fun!

I want to ask you about something else.

Talk to $npcName:11000046[gender:1]$ about a different subject.
What brings you here?
How's it going?
Have you got a new job? I certainly do.
Don't you think my skin has gotten a tad paler these days?
I don't get sunburned anymore.
I'm having as much fun doing this as I did being an oarsman.
But staying indoors all day gives me cabin fever sometimes.
What brings you here?

Justice is just an concept whose meaning no one can even agree on, so how important could it really be? Live free! Laws are for sheep. You've gotta take what you want, that's just the way the world works.
If you wanna win, you've gotta be strong. I can teach you how to be strong.
Justice is just an concept whose meaning no one can even agree on, so how important could it really be? Live free! Laws are for sheep. I can show you how to get what you want.
How can we live free?
Oh yeah? How can I get anything I want?
Are you serious? Have you really been so brainwashed by society that you don't know what it is anymore?
Do what you want and take what you want. That's what it means to be free. If you want it, all you need is the strength to take it.

Justice? Order? Hah! They're for sheep who can't hack it in the wild! If you want to make it in this world you've got to learn how it really works. The only path in life is the one you carve for yourself.
It's simple be a winner. This world is ruled by competition, it's eat or be eaten. Only the best win, so you've gotta try and make sure that's you.
But things don't always go the way you want. You have to know how to turn the tables on your enemy, by any means necessary.

We Thieves are the masters of anything-goes. We can move on our enemies in the blink of an eye, and we've got no problem with poison-coated knives. We do what we have to, and if someone has something we want, we take it. It's simple.
There's no such thing as right and wrong when it comes to winning. There's only you, or them.
Stop bothering me. The only people worth talking to are Thieves, and you're obviously not—wait! You... You're...
You know me?
Of course! You're the Gray Wolf! Everyone in the back alleys of $map:02000100$ knows who you are. I didn't think you'd ever find your way onto the world stage. What made you change your mind?
You've got me mistaken for someone else.
Hm... You're a bad liar. Your eyes give you away. But still, it's interesting to know that major players like you have come out of hiding.
Let's talk about something else.
Blah, blah, blah. You're more talkative than you look. Why are you babbling on like this? Curious about something?
Do you know who I am?

What? No. How would I know that? You some sort of celebrity? No, I didn't think so. The only way I could know who you are is if you were from $map:02000100$. Trust me, I know everyone from that place.
How do you know everyone from there?
Clearly, you should be asking who I am. I'm all over the back alleys of $map:02000100$. I know everything that happens there.
Well, let's hear what you know, then!

Right now, the talk of the town is the Gray Wolf, who decided to leave the shadows of society and duke it out with the Blackstars. Word is that the Gray Wolf singlehandedly razed the Blackstar stronghold.

But that's not even the most interesting part. What's really amazing is the Gray Wolf took on the champion of $map:63000020$! Everyone knows the Champ can't be beaten, but the Gray Wolf went for it anyway! Dumb decision, really. The Warrior wiped the floor with them. There's a reason he's called the Monster, you know.
Is the Champ really that tough?

Wow, you really don't know? He's a champion who successfully defended his title 47 times out of 48 matches. And the one time he didn't win, it was a tie. For the 47 victories, he brought them all down with a single blow, if you can believe it.
What happened with the tie?

Oh, it was amazing! The Warrior couldn't land a blow, no matter how hard he tried, and neither could his opponent. They just kept trying until both were exhausted, and it was really tense to watch. Finally, at the end, they were both heaving with fatigue, barely able to stand. Without a word, the challenger turned and stumbled away.
Tell me about the challenger.

I don't know. No one does! See, as if it weren't dramatic enough, nobody could find out anything, except that the challenger was a were-eagle known to some people in $map:63000020$, who of course would admit nothing.
And why would they? That would be admitting that the Champ isn't invincible.
Change the subject.
Congratulations, $MyPCName$, and welcome to the seedy underbelly of society. Now it's time you learned our ways, from surprise attacks to poisoned blades.
What should I do now?

To take down your enemies you've gotta be fast and precise. For that, you'll need a sharp dagger. $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ should have all kinds of Thief gear. So go get yourself a shiny new blade and use it to carve your own path in life.

Stab enough things, and eventually you'll reach a new level, and that means you get to learn new skills. To see the <font color="#ffd200">skills you can learn</font>, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.

When you're ready to <font color="#ffd200">upgrade a skill</font>, just press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires <font color="#ffd200">Crystals</font>.

Okay, try me. What's freedom?
Oh yeah? How can I get anything I want?
I don't want to talk about this anymore.

Talk to $npcName:11000050[gender:0]$ about a different subject.
Ugh. This place makes me so uncomfortable. Hmm... Your eyes... I can see you're a kindred spirit... How would you like to join us and walk among the shadows?
Happiness, anger, sadness, forgiveness—emotions are just baggage that gets in the way. Your enemies don't deserve your mercy.
Ugh. This place makes me so uncomfortable. Hmm... Your eyes... I can see you're a kindred spirit... You would probably feel at home among the shadows, but you're still too weak to join us.
What's making you so uncomfortable?
Is there something wrong?
My kind is more comfortable in the shadows than in the light. In my line of work, standing around out in the open can get you killed.
Watching $npc:11000043[gender:1]$ over there trying to peddle her philosophy to anybody who makes eye contact... She's all about "doing good deeds and helping the weak." Hah. It makes me wanna hurl.

She's too soft. You help the somebody who can't take care of themselves once, and they'll become reliant on you. Unless they learn how to fend for themselves, they'll never survive in this world. And maybe they don't deserve to.
You're the famed Gray Wolf. Look, let me give you some advice: watch your back.
Is that a threat?
Think of it as a professional courtesy. Your name has been off and on our hit list for some time now.
Are you going to come after me, then?
Not me, no. I'm not foolish enough to tangle with the Gray Wolf. By the way, I never thought you'd come out of the shadows. That's a fascinating development.
Let's talk about something else.
What, do you want to hire me?
Can I hire you?
That depends. There are many things I need to consider, such as how much money you can afford.
You can't hire me for just any sum. Whom do you want me to take care of, anyway? What's the <font color="#ffd200">name</font>?
$npcName:11001559[gender:0]$.
...I'm going to pretend that I didn't hear that. He's one of the greats.
Change the subject.

Ah, a fellow walker of the shadows. If you've made it this far, you should know there's no point helping those who can't help themselves. But you're not weak, are you? Well then, ask me your question.
What should I do now?
If you want to survive in the shadows, you need to blend in $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ has some equipment that should work for you. Gear up, and never let them see you coming.

Talk to $npcName:11000051[gender:1]$ about a different subject.
What brings you here?
I'm always ready to operate at a moment's notice. Hee, hee.
I don't charge a lot for my operations. I can cut you a great deal after I cut you with my scalpel. Hah!
You look a right mess! How about I treat you? It'll only be a measly $paneltyPrice$ mesos. Don't worry, I'm a real doctor!
You don't look like you need my help right now, but you will eventually. Oh yes, trust me on this one. Bad things happen around here all the time.
What seems to be the problem?
Plastic surgery is a gift, I say!
I can transform your entire face!
Imagine your ideal face! I can make it happen...
Oooh, $MyPCName$, I'm so glad you found me. I can work miracles! Everyone says so. Now, what did you have in mind?
Show me the possibilities.
How can I help you?
Beautiful skin is all the rage, and I can make yours positively glow!
Skin is marvelous! So soft, so fleshy...
Hey, do you want me to help make your skin more luminous?
Welcome, $MyPCName$. Thinking about spicing up your look? I can give you any skin tone you like. Care to take a peek?
Yeah, let's do it!
How may I help you?
Put your trust in me, my scissors, and the wild creature within.
Trust my inner beast to save your hairstyles down to the very last strand!
A wild beast sleeps within me... a beast with perfectly styled hair.
Prepare your hair for the unimaginable. The wild beast in my soul will possess these scissors and summon your desired hairstyle from your memories.
Do it! I'm ready!
How may I help you?
I'd like to personally thank you for your patronage.
Did you have a specific style in mind?
$MyPCName$, how shall we style your hair today? Anything you like, just say the word.
Anything? Really? Well, in that case...
How may I help you?
Cosmetics will bring your look to the next level.
Some adventurers are too busy to make time for themselves. It's a real shame.
Well, no, I don't carry real tattoos. Do you know how much those hurt?
Nothing expresses the inner YOU like carefully-selected cosmetics. How'd you like to experiment with a new look?
Yep, time to accessorize!
How may I help you?
Matching colors are so predictable!
Why'd they name pigments after pigs... when ducks are the real masters of color?!
What's the hot color on Maple Island these days? Is it still red?
Did y'know? Ducks have a sharp eye for color! Least this duck does.
Being strong is important, but looking fabulous while you fight is the true key to happiness, y'know. So... wanna spruce up your gear?
Yes! I need more color in my life!
How can I help you?
But you won't be able to do anything, no matter how determined you are, when you're sick.
This is bad. More soldiers are getting wounded by the day.
This area is dangerous. Please be careful.
Oh dear, you're barely clinging to life! Would you like to pay $paneltyPrice$ mesos to get treated now?
You're looking pretty healthy to me, $MyPCName$, but if you're ever sick or wounded, I can help.
How may I help you?
Is everything all right?
Hm, you don't look wounded or ill...
You might look fine. But do you FEEL fine?
Oh dear, you're barely clinging to life! Would you like to pay $paneltyPrice$ mesos to get treated now?

Oh dear, you're barely clinging to life! Would you like to pay $paneltyPrice$ mesos to get treated now?

Just look at that gorgeous reflection! Can you believe that's you?

I've been seeing more patients these days. I wonder why...
Show me where it hurts.
I can make it all go away.

I miss having some spare time to myself.
I tell you, the stress of running a hospital is enough to kill you! And then your only hope for survival depends on how well you managed the hospital!
Oh dear, you're barely clinging to life! Would you like to pay $paneltyPrice$ mesos to get treated now?

What kind of item would you like today?
Spin, spin!
Welcome! $npc:11000474$ is filled with <font color="#ffd200">wondrous items</font>!
Spin $npc:11000474$ for your chance to win the wondrous items! May luck be with you, <font color="#ffd200">$MyPCName$</font>!
You get only <font color="#ffd200">one chance to spin $npc:11000474$</font>. Want to spin $npc:11000474$ again? Then <font color="#ffd200">find another hat</font>!
This might sound crazy, but if you come across a hat in a field, don't hesitate to throw yourself inside of it! You heard me!
What kind of item would you like today?
Spin, spin!
Congratulations, you're a winner! You get to draw a <font color="#ffd200">wondrous item</font>!
Come on, spin the roulette for your chance to win amazing items! May luck be with you, <font color="#ffd200">$MyPCName$</font>!
You get only <font color="#ffd200">one chance to spin $npc:11000475$</font>. Want to spin again? Then you'll have to win again!
I hope you come back and win again soon! Have a lucky journey!
<font color="#909090">(The altar has faded letters written on it.)</font>
<font color="#909090">(Read the message.)</font>
Shadow World is an angry land... Where no blessing upon anyone can make any difference.
Lo, if you are one who thirsts for blood, will you absorb the wrathful energy and rid yourself of $skill:70000029$?
Lose $skill:70000029$.
Retain $skill:70000029$.
The wrathful shadows have devoured every one of your blessings and taken over your mind. Now, you see that friendship is a myth, and everyone is your enemy!
In the end, nothing can truly shield you from reality.

Tell me about your work.

The thing is that <font color="#ffd200">$map:2000076$</font> is absolutely lousy with craftsmen and women. This is the heart of the blacksmithing trade for Maple World, and that makes competition fierce. But that competition is inspiring for people like me. I learn a lot from my peers, and I relate to people who are willing to pour their heart and soul into their work.

You're not here to talk about me though, are you? You need your gear tuned up, I'm your woman. All I need are the right materials, and I'll work my magic. You know what I'm talking about, right? $itemPlural:40100001$, $itemPlural:40100023$, and $itemPlural:40100024$, all produced in $map:2000051$, usually.

<font color="#ffd200">$itemPlural:40100023$</font> come from <font color="#ffd200">dismantling</font> gear that's level 20 or higher. Just use the <font color="#ffd200">Dismantle</font> button in your inventory window. As for <font color="#ffd200">$itemPlural:40100024$</font>, you'll need to dismantle gear that is rated Epic or better.
People compete for <font color="#ffd200">$itemPlural:40100023$</font> in the <font color="#ffd200">Personal Arena</font>, so you could go there. If you think you can win, that is...

By the way, Elliana got ahold of yet another strange weapon, and she's been begging me to enchant it for her. I told her such flashy, impractical weapons like that can't be enchanted, but she doesn't listen. Why can't she just accept that only items marked as "Can be Enchanted" can, well, be enchanted?

That's not all! Aside from functioning as weaponry or armor, high-grade gear grants special abilities. But there's a catch: These abilities are completely random! If you would prefer gear that better suits your needs, I can help you modify it as you like.

This is a new service we blacksmiths provide, thanks to a breakthrough out of the research center in $map:02000270$. Those eggheads figured out how to refine meteoric ores into these $itemPlural:40100026$ that I can use to change the chemical properties in your gear.

Now, don't get your hopes all the way up. $itemPlural:40100026$ are tricky to work with, so I might not be able to get all the bonuses on your item to exactly what you want. I also need $itemPlural:40100001$, $itemPlural:40100002$, $itemPlural:40100003$, or $itemPlural:40100021$ to work with, and that's up to you to get.
Everyone knows I'm the best smith... on this street.

Great artisans are a dime-a-dozen in $map:2000076$. This is the place to be if you aim to make a living at crafting. It makes competition fierce, sure, but that only forces me to push myself harder. And it's kind of inspirational, being around all these people who live for their craft.

Anyway, if you want to strengthen your equipment, come to me. Just remember that you'll need to bring some special materials. You probably know which ones... the $itemPlural:40100001$, $itemPlural:40100023$, and $itemPlural:40100024$ that $map:2000051$ is so famous for.

You can get $itemPlural:40100023$ by dismantling gear that's level 20 or higher. Just use the Dismantle button in your inventory window. As for $itemPlural:40100024$, that comes at a much higher cost. It only comes from dismantling gear that is epic or better.
People compete for $itemPlural:40100023$ in the Personal Arena, so you could go there. If you think you can win, that is...

Have you heard about $itemPlural:40100026$? They were invented by those eggheads in $map:02000270$. I hear they're made from real meteors! With a material like that, I can change the bonus attributes on a piece of gear.

So you want to change the bonus attributes on this gear, eh? Sounds good to me! Hey, why the anxious look on your face? If you don't like the new attributes, you can always keep the old ones, and then just try to change them again.

Okay, then! See if you like any of these new attributes. You can choose anything you like. If you don't choose anything, then the new attributes will automatically overwrite the old ones. Choose carefully!

<font color="#ffd200">$itemPlural:40100023$</font> come from <font color="#ffd200">dismantling</font> gear that's level 20 or higher. Just use the <font color="#ffd200">Dismantle</font> button in your inventory window. As for <font color="#ffd200">$itemPlural:40100024$</font>, you'll need to dismantle gear that is rated Epic or better.
People compete for <font color="#ffd200">$itemPlural:40100023$</font> in the <font color="#ffd200">Personal Arena</font>, so you could go there. If you think you can win, that is...

Keep in mind that the only items you can enchant are Top, Bottom, Suit, and Weapon items at level 20 or above. That frustrates some folks, but I need a solid base to work from. Elliana found some weird weapon she wanted to enchant, but she doesn't get that there are rules to these things. I'm good, but even I have my limits!

I'd love to help you, but right now I have to focus on this special order from the palace. No exceptions! Absolutely not! You wouldn't want me to stop your order to work on someone else's, so why would you expect me to do that to the palace?
What is it?
I better take a break from the forge and do some finishing. Did you see my jig or wire brush around?
Let's see...
I've been standing all day over a hot forge!
Would you like to enchant your gear?
Just a quick rap on the anvil to break off the fire scale, and this sword is done... Oh, hello. Have you come to enchant your gear?
Can you enchant my items?
How about we change some bonus attributes?
Tell me about your work.
Hehe. I'm a blacksmith.
I love the work that I do. There's nothing more satisfying than using my wrench to tinker with gear or banging metal into shape in front of a hot forge.
If you need to strengthen your equipment, come to me! You'll have to gather the materials: $itemPlural:40100001$, $itemPlural:40100023$, and $itemPlural:40100024$.

You can get $itemPlural:40100023$ by dismantling level 20 or higher gear. Just use the Dismantle button in your inventory window. As for $itemPlural:40100024$, they'll only come from dismantling gear that's epic or better.
People also compete for $itemPlural:40100023$ at the Maple Arena, if that's something you're interested in.
I used to enchant low level gear for people, but we all soon realized it's just not worth it. So now, I only enchant items marked as "Can be Enchanted."
Oh! One more thing! I'm sure you know that some high-grade gear grant random special abilities. If you're interested in modifying those abilities, I can help!

This is a brand new service blacksmiths can provide, thanks to a breakthrough at the $map:02000270$ research center. Hehe. They've refined meteoric ores into $itemPlural:40100026$ that can change the chemical properties in gear!

Of course, bonus attributes are hard to rely on since the results are so random. And in addition to $itemPlural:40100026$, you'll also need $itemPlural:40100001$, $itemPlural:40100002$, $itemPlural:40100003$, or $itemPlural:40100021$, depending on the work being done.
Oh! Of course! Just pick an item for me to work on. Remember, I only handle epic and legendary armor and accessories level 50 and above.
Is this the gear you want to change? Okay! Don't worry, if you don't like the new attributes, you can keep the old ones.
I would love to change your bonus attributes for you! I just need the necessary materials, hehe.
What do you think? Do you like the new attributes? Remember, if you don't choose anything, the new attributes will automatically be applied.
If you're not satisfied with the current attributes, you can always try again. Just bring the materials, hehe.
Oh, dear. This gear is a bit advanced for me. Could I help you with a different piece, perhaps?
Oh! Sure thing! Select an item for me to enchant. It's got to have the "Can be Enchanted" mark on it, you hear?
I can't enchant this gear. The process to do so is too unstable. Perhaps you have a different item for me to enchant?

Oh no! You don't have all the materials you need! You can get $itemPlural:40100001$ from gear merchants and supply merchants and $itemPlural:40100023$ by dismantling level 20 or higher gear. $itemPlural:40100024$ are a bit more rare and only comes from dismantling gear that's epic or better. Use the Dismantle button in your inventory window to dismantle.
Legendary gear! I see so many pieces every day, but it's rare for anyone to bring me an item this precious. It will be my honor to enchant this.
What?! This is legendary gear! I haven't worked on such a precious piece in a long time. I've got butterflies in my stomach.
You picked a good piece of gear to be enchanted! Wait until you see how it turns out!
Oh! This piece has never been enchanted before. That should make it really easy for me, hehe.
This gear has never been enchanted before. Should be a cinch, then. Here goes...
Oh, dear me! Someone failed at enchanting this item 100 items?!
You've failed in enchanting this gear 100 times, and you still want to try again? Are you sure? I really wish you'd brought this to me to begin with. Oh, dear.
Oh, dear!! Someone failed in enchanting this gear 1,000 times?! How is that even possible?
I can't enchant this gear. The process to do so is too unstable. Perhaps you have a different item for me to enchant?
I can't enchant this gear. The process to do so is too unstable. Perhaps you have a different item for me to enchant?
Oh my, it's impossible to enchant this gear any further. Don't look glum. It's already really strong!
I know you're the type who likes to rise to any challenge, but even you and your gear have limits. And sometimes, it's wiser to quit than to try to push things past their natural limit.
That piece of gear is beyond my ability to enchant. The $itemPlural:40100023$ required would become too instable during the process, you see. Even $npc:11000508[gender:1]$ agrees with me on that one.
Everyone has a piece of gear or two that they feel sentimental about. I have an entire closet full. But love isn't enough to allow you to enchant your gear an unlimited number of times.
Easy peasy, hehe! Don't worry, you're in good hands!
Hehe, this is so straightforward, I could do it with my eyes closed. Want to see?
I think we know how this is going to turn out, hehe. Here goes!
Hmm, this shouldn't be too difficult. Shall I begin?
I'm always happy to help. All you need to do is bring the materials, hehe.
Some of the others call my enchanting skills legendary, because I never fail. I don't know, though... My way requires a lot more materials. Does that really make it better?
Low level gear doesn't require many materials to enchant.
This shouldn't be difficult.
I can guarantee success on this enchant, and it doesn't even require that many additional materials, hehe.
This piece of gear can be easily enchanted.
This shouldn't be too difficult.
This piece of gear needs more materials to enchant than before, but success is guaranteed, hehe!
You'll need a lot of materials to enchant this, but if you provide it all, success is guaranteed, hehe.
Do you have all the materials? Just remember, you're spending extra materials for a guaranteed result! I hope that motivates you, hehe.
I require a lot of materials, true... but I also never fail.
You may need to invest extra time and effort to use my services, but I never ever fail.
For my method of enchanting, you get what you put in! It costs more materials, sure, but it's guaranteed success!
Don't be intimidated by the material requirements... Think about the end result: guaranteed enchantment!
True, I ask for a lot of materials, but isn't it worth it?
I can enchant your gear as many times as you like, as long as you have all the materials.
I know other blacksmiths don't require as many materials as I do, but they fail in their work sometimes. I don't.
I know I require a lot of materials, but that's the price of quality, hehe.
My service costs more, but you get that you pay for! Bad luck never gets in my way!
I know some folks enjoy the thrill of a good deal. Just remember: my method allows me to enchant your gear with guaranteed success.
It'll be worth the material cost, I promise!
From now on, I'll need even more materials. You might want to mentally prepare yourself, hehe.
Yes, I require a lot of materials, but remember... the enchantment I offer is fail-safe.
Don't try to max out your gear's enchantment level all at once. It'd be too overwhelming.
$MyPCName$, I know it takes a lot of time and effort to gather so many materials, but once you have them, I promise to successfully enchant your gear. Hehe.
You're going to try for +14? That will take a lot of materials! I can do it, sure, but it'll be quite a bit of work, hehe.
Do you think you'll be able to gather all the materials? It's really quite a lot!
I can enchant gear as many times as you want, as long as you have enough materials. But I have to say, enchanting to +15 requires many, many materials. +14 is already very strong, isn't it?
+15... now that makes me nervous. I mean, reaching +15 has always been my dream, but it requires so very many materials. You can't possibly have all of them, can you?
I could practice enchanting for the next hundred years and still wouldn't be able to enchant this piece of gear. It's already so strong!
Challenges are what make life interesting, but some challenges can't be overcome, and this is simply one of them.
I can't enchant this gear any further. It's so unstable that it could blow up the whole street if I fail.
+15 gear really exists! Amazing! Hehe, you realize that no blacksmith in the world can enchant this piece any further, don't you? I'd be happy to help you with other pieces of gear, though.
This piece of gear is already strong. I don't think I can make it any stronger...
Enchanting gear requires precise skill and tons of practice.
Blacksmithing makes me smile. Nothing beats working over a flame!
Sure, it'd be great if enchantments never failed. But then again, that would make us blacksmiths go broke! Ha, ha!
It worked! Hehe, it always works! But it still makes me so happy every single time.
Hehe, see? I told you the enchantment would go great!
Success! Yes! Hehe. I hope you enjoyed my services!
Success! You provided lovely materials. Nicely done!
Hehehe, I'm not bad,right? See you again soon!
Hehe, nice, right? I hope we can work together again soon!
Your gear has reached +10! Hey, you've earned it with your determination and courage in taking risks!
Thank you for all your hard work, $MyPCName$!
How did you gather so many materials? Incredible!
I can't believe you gathered all of these materials. Very impressive!
I will certainly remember you, $MyPCName$. Few people could have done what you did.
Am I dreaming? Is this really happening? I always thought +15 was impossible, but we really did it!
I hope you're happy with my service, hehe! Come again!
All in a day's work, hehe.

Uh-oh. It seems the ratio of $item:40100023$ was off, and it decreased your gear's enchantment level by one. I'm sorry; I misjudged the carbon content in your gear. I'll take responsibility for this one.
I knew the $item:40100023$ was unstable, but I never thought it would decrease the gear's enchantment level... I'mso, so sorry, but at least it only decreased by one.
Um... well, the bad news is the enchantment failed. The good news is it could have been much worse.
Oh, the enchantment failed. It's not our fault... Whoever made this gear didn't case-harden it enough, so it's random chance whether it can tolerate enchantments.
Oops, I thought this would be easy...
I promise, this only happens once in a blue moon, and it's just random bad luck that it was your gear it happened to.

Oh, geez, I damaged your gear during the attempt! I'm... I'm sorry! Maybe I'm in the wrong line of work... Look, I managed to save this $item:40100025$. Please, take it. At least if you collect enough of those, you could find some use for them.

Aww... I was full of dread when I started, and I was right to be so. Your gear couldn't handle the pressure of the enchantment, and it got damaged. Its enchantment effects will reset in 10 days. And I'm sorry, but now it can never be enchanted again.
Oh no! This isn't good...
Ah, the enchantment failed! Well, at least your gear wasn't damaged. You got lucky this time, $MyPCName$. Please think carefully before you try another enchantment! It would be risky for your gear.
This item is... difficult for me. Is there a different piece I could help you with?
I'm so sorry! I'm swamped! Never been so busy in my life. I'm working on a special order, you see.
Can you enchant my items?
What do you do?
Hehe. I'm a blacksmith.
I love the work that I do. There's nothing more satisfying than using my wrench to tinker with gear or banging metal into shape in front of a hot forge.
If you need to strengthen your equipment, come to me! You'll have to gather the materials: $itemPlural:40100001$, $itemPlural:40100023$, and $itemPlural:40100024$.

You can get $itemPlural:40100023$ by dismantling level 20 or higher gear. Just use the Dismantle button in your inventory window. As for $itemPlural:40100024$, they'll only come from dismantling gear that's epic or better.
People also compete for $itemPlural:40100023$ at the Maple Arena, if that's something you're interested in.
Some customers desire for me to enchant low level gear, but it's simply not worth the time. I only enchant items marked as "Can be Enchanted."
I'd love to help you, but for now I have to focus on this special order I've got. I'll take especially good care of you if you come back later, I promise.
What do you want?
One day, I'll be a hotshot adventurer, too.
Hello there!
What's that smell?
Can't you see I'm busy?
Do you have old enchanted equipment you don't need anymore? I'll turn it into a scroll so you can transfer the enchantment to your new gear!

My wife... and my child...
Can I save lives?
You look a right mess! How about I treat you? It'll only be a measly $paneltyPrice$ mesos. Don't worry, I'm a real doctor!

I'm a real doctor with years of experience. And degrees. Many, many medical degrees.

Ahoy!
Welcome to the $map:02000124$ cruise ship!
$map:02000124$ is where the worst criminals of all get locked up. We run tours to show the free, law-abiding citizens why they should stay law-abiding.
It's <font color="#ffd200">1,000 mesos</font> to take a tour of the prison. Are you interested?
The $map:02000124$ cruise ship will depart soon!
The tour of $map:02000124$ costs 1,000 mesos. And you gotta hurry!
A cruise ship is about to depart for $map:02000124$, where the most notorious criminals are kept!
Hey there! You looking for the cruise ship to $map:02000124$?
Yep!
What is $map:02000124$?
Hey, it's <font color="#ffd200">1,000 mesos</font> to take a tour of the prison.
Looks like you're short on cash. Come on back when you've got it, because this tour is worth the money! You've never seen such suffering, such misery! It builds character.
$map:02000124$ is where the worst criminals of all get locked up. We run tours to show the free, law-abiding citizens why they should stay law-abiding.
How may I help you?
This <font color="#ffd200">Guild Lounge</font> is for members only. Did you have a question?
What are guilds?
What is the guild lounge?
A guild is an alliance of like-minded heroes. $npc:11000075[gender:1]$ encourages heroes to form guilds, so they can all benefit from each other's talents.
How does one create a guild?
The Guild Lounge is a special space for members only. It <font color="#ffd200">sells a variety of items for guild members</font>.
But even if you're in a guild, you might not be able to buy items. For that, your particular guild has to have the right.
Whether a guild has the right depends on its number of Guild Trophies. Guild Trophies are the combined Hero Trophies of everyone in the guild.
Each item sold at the Guild Lounge <font color="#ffd200">requires a different number of Guild Trophies</font>. So it's beneficial to have as many Trophies as possible at all times.
How does one create a guild?
Press <font color="#ffd200">G</font>, and a window will open where you can create a guild. Each new guild requires approval from the palace, and that costs <font color="#ffd200">5,000 mesos</font>.
If you want to enter the <font color="#ffd200">Guild Lounge</font>, then please create or join a guild.
Welcome, $MyPCName$. It's an honor. Would you like to enter the Guild Lounge?
How may I help you?
Only members can use the Guild Lounge.
I hope you enjoyed your stay. Would you like to leave the Guild Lounge now?
How may I help you?
Absolutely lovely today, isn't it?
Hm, you don't look wounded or ill...
You might look fine. But do you FEEL fine?
Oh dear, you're barely clinging to life! Would you like to pay $paneltyPrice$ mesos to get treated now?
You're looking pretty healthy to me, $MyPCName$, but if you're ever sick or wounded, I can help.
Welcome.
Welcome.
Welcome.

What brings you here?
I sure am tired these days.
It feels like for every patient I treat, three more walk through the door.
You look a right mess! How about I treat you? It'll only be a measly $paneltyPrice$ mesos. Don't worry, I'm a real doctor!
You don't look like you need my help right now, but you will eventually. Oh yes, trust me on this one. Bad things happen around here all the time.
What brings you here?
Please lower your voice. I have a headache.
If feels like someone's swinging a hammer against the inside of my head...
You look a right mess! How about I treat you? It'll only be a measly $paneltyPrice$ mesos. Don't worry, I'm a real doctor!

I admit, I like the money I'm making, but...
This place is too far away from everything.
